Notes: Out of date! would like to try again.
Really nice, rich brown ale. One of the best in the world surely.
Out of date! would like to try again.
Very good mocha porter; rich flavour, strong and smooth.
Very strong ale, quite sweet but not overwhelming. Really powerful flavour/alcohol.
Interesting caramel taste. Was warm so would like to try again.
Not as bad as expected. Very drinkable with some malt in the flavour but otherwise not a lot.
Solid world-renowned wheat beer. Does it live up to expectations? Probably not but still very refreshing and enjoyable.
Strong smoked lager. Got a fairly unique taste, which is a very pleasant one indeed.
The balance on this one was excellent! Not too hoppy despite the name. A really great beer which I find to be near perfect.
Pretty good, with a very fresh organic taste.
Nice neat label and the beer matches it. Nice rich, clean flavour and great carbonation. Very good.
Rich.
Quite a strong French blonde, very satisfying. One of my favourite French beers.
Slightly hoppy, unbalanced yet satisfying.
Well-rounded.
Surprisingly enjoyable.
Disjointed, amateur.
Surprisingly solid, enjoyable.
Rich pine flavour.
Reliable brown ale.
Lifeless, disappointing.
Rich, refreshing & interesting.
Great balance and head/body. A hoppy lager but balanced well. A pleasure to drink!
Far more interesting flavour. Very good.
Unremarkable.
Strong, rich yet unfinished or would need time to mature?
Decent lager, but not great.
Interesting ginger flavour.
Sublime, dark, great character.
Solid and interesting blonde.
Strong but nice taste and moreish!
Very pleasant, apple balanced well with the beer.
High quality lager, most enjoyable.
Slightly disappointing but still nice.
Good quality ale; refreshing.
Drank from bottle but still enjoyable. Rich taste.
Pleasant and refreshing. Good on draft.
One of the better widely available beers.
Quite good, strong but great taste.
Very dry and bitter. Enjoyed towards end but still unsure.
Another good quality blonde on draft.
Slightly vinegary and amateurish but otherwise nice.
Quite sweet and smooth. Pleasant.
Not too strong, has a great flavour.
An excellent strong IPA. Perfect?
Subtle strawberry taste, all round nice beer.
Good malt character, nice beer.
Not as salty as expected; pleasant overall.
Good character, toasted flavour is obvious.
Very crisp.
On draft, surprisingly good! Nice flavour.
Very fresh, as expected. Decent.
Not too sweet; overall rich and satisfying.
Almost tasteless (but I had the cold!)
Poor, generic taste.
Well-rounded and very refreshing.
Honey not too dominant. Just the right balance. Well made!
Wasn't very impressed.
Ok hot-weather lager.
Ok hot-weather lager.
Ok hot-weather lager.
Surprisingly good - nice banana flavour.
Inconsistent, but the best one was very nice indeed!
Lives up to the hype - good!
Dark, rich, complex, sublime.
Light but decent wheat beer.
Rich, creamy taste. Good!
Pleasant amber. Artisanal taste.
Was very crisp and citrussy like grapefruit.
A bit like the blanche. Pleasant also.
Drank after uphill walk, yet still tasted like a good quality lager.
Very crisp, refreshing. Pleasant taste.
Clean, crisp, decent lager
Crisp, slightly creamy lager. Strong malt aftertaste.
Has more flavour than expected and a bit of character. In the heat after a walk was very pleasant.
Malty, rich taste. Like a darker, more sophisticated lager.
Carried for  many miles since Pamplona in blazing sun. Tasted  bit wierd with solid sediment so may have been off!
Had some really interesting flavours here. Enjoyed even though drank out of an almost warm bottle. I'm very keen to try again chilled/draft.
Very drinkable and well balanced with good malt character.
Average drinkable lager, nothing particularly bad. Will happily drink again in the sun.
Fragrant, drinkable aromatic. Nice, mild flavour from the honey. Pleasant.
Standard lager but with a bit more character than the standard Mahou. Highly drinkable.
Like San Miguel but richer. Ok but has a bitter malty taste which lets it down.
Pale lager, which I found to be refreshing and above average.
Crisp, refreshing, full-bodied. Above average by Spanish standards.
Cheap supermarket lager - was thirst quenching and better than I expected.
Ordinary drinkable lager. Notably better on draft.
Solid Belgian dubbel but not quite rubbing shoulders with the best Belgium has to offer.
Rich, very strong and super sweet. Sweetest beer I've tasted. Great in small quantities.
Tastes like a lager on steroids. Quite drinkable and good.
Good quality malty-flavoured beer.
Coffee/ chocolate notes, very smooth and full-bodied, with healthy head. Very good.
Solid blonde ale, lives up to the expectations of a typical Belgian blonde.
Strong red ale, went down very well. Easily one of the best from Spain.
Surprisingly good, coming from Spain. Hoppy IPA full of character and a great example of what "craft" beer should be.
Smooth, strong stout with a pleasant flavour. Very drinkable.
A decent and refreshing weiss but like the others, seemingly more style over substance.

Brewer: Sociedade Central de Cervejas e Bebidas (Heineken)
Notes: Drinkable, straightforward lager.
Drinkable & refreshing with a slightly herbal taste. Overall was a bit anaemic and disappointing.
C'est bizarre! Tastes salty and sour - hard to know if it's supposed to be that way or is slightly off. Strangely drinkable though. I want to sample fresh on draught!
Couldn't really taste cherries but it was very smooth with nice burnt, toasted flavours.
Crisp, clean pilsner. Pleasant flavour.
Well-rounded and smooth porter. Impressive.
Somehow surprised at the quality. Tasted organic and fresh with an excellent overall balance.
Very crisp & refreshing, and low ABV. Very good.
Decent dubbel with high carbonation.
Smooth, rich.
Hoppy, dry saison.
Bitter, harsh, fruity.

Beer: Dia De Los Muertos Pay the Ferryman Porter
Notes: Coffee, fruity, slightly watery.
Smooth, coffee, creamy.
Crisp, hoppy, malty.
Nice but not outstanding. There are better IPAs out there with more character.
Pale ale with rich malty character.
Great, slightly fruity taste.
Quite a refreshing, malty lager. Made for the Golf Inn?
Highly carbonated; tart, sour taste, rich red colour. Took a little while, but I grew to really enjoy it.
Fresh, well carbonated. Slightly spiced flavour; overall a good flavour and a good beer. Want to try the others from this brewery.
Citrusy, dry, hoppy beer, with potent smell and light, cloudy appearance. Quite good.
Good foam, cloudy with salt in the sediment. Pleasant light taste with the sea salt barely noticeable but there's definitely a hint there. Pretty enjoyable beer.
Strong brown beer, with rich caramel flavour. Bitter alcohol taste at the end but overall good.
No head, very flat yet very drinkable with a very agreeable flavour. Salt & pepper were very subtle. Really enjoyed it.
A "farmhouse ale", with honey and figs. Interesting concept, with the ingredients subtly present in the flavour and a dominant malty tast - but poor balance.
Surprisingly good for a supermarket brand beer, but it is brewed in Belgium. Very fresh & crisp, with nice flavour. Good blonde!
Fruity smell, this Spanish take on a Belgian dubbel has quite a nice rich taste, but it seems obvious that it's not quite as good as the real deal.
A perfect balance of sweetness/tartness make this rich fruit beer a real joy. Excellent flavour leaves you wanting more.
Decent lager.
Ok brown ale.. A bit too strong in the alcohol department to be a standout but otherwise not bad.
Sweeti-sh, sour-ish, geuze-ish beer. Decent quality and enjoyable.
Quite a sweet cheery beer. I preferred the cassis, but this one's still enjoyable - but tends towards tasting like fruit juice.
Fruity, rich brown beer, which hides its strength well. Sweet taste but overall a very enjoyable beer,

Definitely a taste of raspberries and I can appreciate the intention, but what ruins this for me is the strong alcohol taste. I wish this was 3% weaker - such a shame as could be great. Simply didn't enjoy it.
Impeccably smooth & refreshing, this doesn't have a great deal of flavour but is pretty nice.
Fresh, well-carbonated wheat beer with a dry finish. Quite enjoyable. Good beer.
Dark & heavy with a strong coffee taste. Wasn't sure at first but towards the end of the bottle started to enjoy more. Would indeed be nice at breakfast! Must try then.
Nice malted beer. Good mouthfeel.
Pleasant lager but doesn't stand out particularly.
Rich, dark cherry beer. Great balance, fruity and just very enjoyable. Lovely!
Dark beer with rich and complex flavour. Reminds me of Carolus Classic. Excellent.
Herbal, peppery, spiced blond with a smooth and creamy texture, served in a funny glass. Very enjoyable indeed!
Good, solid satisfying blonde with slightly peppery taste.

Wasn't sure at first; sweet and fruity but the flavour balance didn't seem great. A couple of glasses later and it convinced me that it was indeed an enjoyable beer, despite there being many superior ones out there.
Very dark, rich, slightly spiced ale. Great winter warmer and good quality beer.
Mainstream lager, but not bad by world standards. Decent malty character and good texture..
Tastes somehow incomplete, is a bit like fizzy water with a touch of honey. Not a good beer.
Good quality blonde, a bit hoppy. Nice.
Bold, rich stout with chocolatey flavour. Smooth and with excellent balance, this is a very good imperial stout.
Does what it says on the tin - it's brown in colour and tastes of nuts. An impressive creation, very nice indeed.
Fruity, herbal, light and refreshing. Very nice.
Very smooth and velvety with a nice malty flavour.
Dark, strong ale with complex flavour, mainly liquorice. Quite a unique taste, decent.
Very crisp, with complexity in the flavour, mainly dominated by citrus. Impressive.
Strong black ale, with the taste of the whisky obvious. Overall the balance is excellent; the beer has a nice rich sweetness to it, together with the malts providing a great depth.
A decent barley wine, with the alcohol strength well disguised. The taste is rich and deep, and it's well balanced. Very nice.
A good wheat beer with typical flavours of banana etc. However, overshadowed by the quality of the German wheats. Still, a solid, refreshing effort.
Fruity, dry, hoppy blonde. Doesn't taste strong and has great balance. Great!
Great quality triple. Softer than the Achel but similar. Almost perfectly formed.
Fruit beer with sweet candied smell. Taste was a bit strange, and reminded me of a sugar free raspberry yoghurt. Surely they didn't use sweetener?! Otherwise ok.
Very drinkable fruity, malty beer. Pleasant.
Very full on with the hops, but with a nice fruitiness rather than being overly bitter. Rich & complex, really packs a punch.
Strong, rich imperial stout. The alcohol isn't overpowering as this beer is so well made, with a great balance and strong coffee notes.
Crisp, tart & well-carbonated, barely tastes of alcohol despite the strength. Very refreshing, I feel I could enjoy this even more once I'm more accustomed to the style.
Crisp & tart, with nice raspberry aroma and faintly sweet. Cordial-like but a good strength of ABV to make it interesting.
Brown in colour, crisp/carbonated with subtle flavours. There's a slight hoppy bitterness there but otherwise a bit bland. Drinkable nonetheless.
Solid brown beer; very smooth, slightly sweet with the alcohol barely noticeable.

Building upon the already very nice Chew Chew, this one has been enhanced with raspberries and is a more impressive beast. Fruity and thick, it's like a pudding in a glass and a very enjoyable one at that. It's 10% ABV is very well disguised by the rich, lovely flavour.
Smooth & easy to drink with a yeasty/spiced taste and good amount of sediment in the bottle. Great beer.
Sadly lost a bit when I opened the bottle. Volatility aside, this is a great beer, with liquorice, treacle & spice flavours. Excellent balance and rich flavour.
I'm not a big rum fan but it definitely makes this an interesting beer with a rich, dark taste.
Standard hoppy blonde ale, with a good bitter hop character, which doesn't overwhelm.
Decent porter with coffee flavour.
A very rich brew, smoky and fruity, with some sweetness. Tastes quite thick as well. Has a great complexity and balance. Excellent winter beer.
Big foamy head, well carbonated yet smooth pale ale, this had a very fresh, hop-dominated taste and was bitter - enjoyable, certainly not bland.
Fairly standard Belgian triple - in that it's of a high quality and very enjoyable, with the high ABV being well disguised.
Blackberry beer. Not much carbonation but the smell and taste are rich in fruits. Good balance of flavour and a rich, enjoyable beer.
Hoppy in a good way; not very bitter with fruity/floral aroma/taste and lots of sediment in the bottle. Very pleasant beer.
Fresh, sweetish, enjoyable beer. Didn't taste well due to man flu.
Like a triple but with added oomf; wheats flavours and great balance overall.
I recall this had a nice flavour and was surprisingly well-balanced for a French beer!
An enjoyable, smooth & very drinkable blonde. Another example of a supermarket brand beer surpassing expectations.
Good carbonation and foam presence. Strong, but with a great balance of hops & malt and has a great character, which is especially evident in the aftertaste. Excellent beer.
Sweet and slightly bitter, citrus taste, like it's mixed with grapefruit juice. Lacking complexity but a solid tasting and good beer with assertive character.
Flat and toffee-coloured. Not impressive but it has a subtle caramel taste and is very drinkable.

Highly carbonated, this tastes a bit like the brewer chucked some water, malt, yeast etc into a bucket and hopes for the best. Just doesn't taste as if the ingredients are combined to make a cohesive whole. Has an aftertaste of - essentially - fizzy water.
Sweet and slightly industrial tasting, this lacks the richness and character typically found in other Belgian Xmas beers. That said, still quite enjoyable and by no means bad.
Again, the palate is dominated by carbonated water. Flavour seems to play second fiddle in what is not a good beer.
Yeasty, slightly sweet amber-coloured ale. Has an excellent balance and pleasant fizzy mouthfeel.
Good balance of hops/malt, make for an interesting, subtle flavour.
Crisp, refreshing, slightly sweet blonde beer. Good.
Smelled like something from the medicine cabinet, didn't taste a lot better. Some subtle taste of honey but a bit overly carbonated. While poor, slightly better than the others.

Brewer: Payesa Cervecera S.L @ Cerveses La Gardènia
Notes: Amber-coloured ale with a full-bodied rich flavour, with malts et al. Excellently balanced and very enjoyable.
Very pleasant; light & malty; the sort of beer you could drink several of in one sitting.
Dark with no head. Rich chocolatey/nutty/liquorice flavour. Despite the 10% ABV this was pleasant to drink.
Crisp and tart with pure red colour. Light, refreshing and barely sweet at all.

Obviously spicy; dominated by a peppery taste. The lasting impression is of bitterness. That said, it's packed with kick and character and feels great I'm the mouth, similar to other Fantome beers. A very enjoyable saison style beer with peppery edge.
Smooth, rich chocolate & coffee stout. Tastes very nice indeed, a bit like dessert in a glass.
Hoppy but with a pleasant counterbalance of other ingredients.
Not as bitter as the name may suggest, and has a very good balance, with some fruity, as well as hoppy, elements.
Crisp and fresh on the palate, it's an enjoyable golden ale with character.
Very fruity smell, but taste is more bitter and less sweet than that might suggest. Overall an enjoyable beer with hops and fruit combining to good effect.
Nice aroma, this is a very pleasant pale ale with good balance and a flavour that is never dull.
Fruity aroma, and an interesting and complex flavour. Definitely tastes like a mix of different hops. Very enjoyable.
Brown, with nice fruity, caramel smell. To taste, although drinkable, it is a little watery and incomplete-tasting, but it does have a pleasant caramel and malt flavour. Ok.
Cloudy amber, taste is malty and slightly sweet like honey. Quite strong alcohol but not unpleasant. Quite a good beer.
Subtle and a bit flat, but quietly confident, like you might imagine a Japanese man of honour. Overall a pleasant, refreshing beer with a hint of orange and spice.
Very dark, rich, smooth. Liquorice, spices, Xmas pud. Sweet, but not too sweet. High ABV but extremely well hidden. Beautiful balance. Excellent.
Overall smooth and a decent stout, but for me there was something - a bitterness? - there that was a bit strong. Hence the balance was a bit of a let down.
Hoppy beer with strong amber colour and very carbonated. A mix of fruitiness and bitterness due to the hops. Full of character and very enjoyable.

By Belgian standards, a weak beer, but this is an amber pale ale of over 5%. Has a nice malty character with a bit of sweetness there too. Good beer, and I'm sure the reputed unpasteurised draft version would be well worth seeking out.
Smooth black porter with toasted malt flavours. The addition of ginger and oats works well and makes for an well-rounded and very enjoyable flavour overall.
Good quality IPA, well balanced.
Interesting stout, full of flavour and character.
Strong IPA which appears to make great use of hops. A mix of fruity and bitter which makes overall a very satisfying brew - but don't drink too many at once!
Bottle from Royal Mile whisky shop. Smooth, dark porter with rich coffee and smoked notes. Highly drinkable and with an overall satisfying flavour. Good cold weather beer.
Creamy smell/taste and creamy in the mouth. A good balance of whisky flavour to the beer and a decent brew overall but not outstanding.
Good head on this. The taste is that of rich dark fruits, and the 11% alcohol is very well hidden indeed. If it wasn't Wednesday I may have drank a second one. Excellent.
Quite a good, if watery stout with an earthy flavour.
Weak by Belgian standards, a sweet & sour beer that has an excellent balance of both and is very drinkable and refreshing indeed.
Perhaps a tad strong but overall a rich brown ale, with distinct flavour.
Could taste the spices a bit, but not as much as expected. Anyway, an interesting and unusual blend but it works well. Unique and moreish.
Disappointed by how strong this was. I get the flavour, especially of the orange zest, but just feel this could be so much better. Got another bottle for 2nd opinion.
Quite a weak flavour but unmistakably a pale ale. Very easy to drink and pleasant on the palate. Understated.
Typical burnt malt and coffee flavours but quite weak and not much to write home about.
Very impressed by this quad. Interesting blend of ingredients. Too strong for some but I found the alcohol very well disguised and this beer to be rich, fruity and immensely satisfying.
A little watery and unfinished-tasting, but the smoked malt flavour - although subtle - wins over in the end and this turns out to be an enjoyable beer.
Typical kolsch; not much to say other than it has the expected light malty taste and is a refreshing, satisfying beer.
Decent pilsner. Light yet full-bodied with enjoyable malt character. Could easily drink several in one sitting.
Mix of strong citrus, tea and spice flavours. Not as big a head as other Fantomes. Overall an interesting, enjoyable blend and another fascinating beer from Fantome.
Surprisingly good beer with solid flavour.
Strong lager with nice malt flavour.
Bland, generic.
Amber-coloured, crisp, refreshing, light, hoppy ale. Pleasant overall.
Amber and full bodied, flavour of caramel and roasted malts.
Smooth yet crisp, coffee aroma/flavour, hints of vanilla. Quite strong lingering taste. Perhaps could do with more depth/balance but overall it's quite good.
Great bouquet of floral hops, hint of maltiness, great balance. It's all about the hops but there's enough going on to make it a very satisfying pale ale.
Very hoppy amber ale, reminiscent of Brew Dog. Solid combination of hops and caramel sweetness.
High carbonation, citrussy, hoppy. Quite refreshing with hint of grapefruit. Unusual.
Subtle tasting beer with lightly toasted aroma and flavour. Easy to drink and enjoyable, I'd have it again.
Nice toasted malt flavour, like 1906 Reserva? Good.
Standard supermarket lager but it was enjoyable enough and preferable to Tennents or Fosters.
Lager made for Lidl, Spain? For a canned lager it had a nice body of flavour.
barnyard smell, wierd sour/bitter taste. Overall I still enjoyed but it's not great.
good IPA, with nice fruity character. Well balanced and pretty good quality (surprising for Spain!)
crisp and subtle, with a lingering wheaty flavour and overall it was rather nice.

fruity smell. Very much a stout, very much coffee flavoured; fruitiness/bitterness combine to make something original. It's a subdued bitterness and the pronounced coffee notes make sure it does exactly what it says on the tin.
coffee/roasted flavour, slight bitter taste. Ok but a bit unbalanced - too bitter?
good head, cloudy yellow. Has a crisp, citrus hoppy taste to it and is quite refreshing, if slightly unbalanced.
fruity, malty, slightly sweet strong ale. Enjoyable but has perhaps a lingering alcohol presence that overstays its welcome in the mouth.
slight roasted malt flavour which is pleasant. Tasted a bit mass-produced but otherwise it's ok.
had a sort of weak, bitter taste that didn't really work for me (it was a lot like that rice ale). Not too bad, but not for me.
very crisp and refreshing with pleasant citrus body. I didn't think there was a lot going on with the flavour but it was so crisp and refreshing.
earthy smell, full-bodied, slightly creamy with a malty flavour. Overall pretty satisfying and balanced.
fruity/earthy smell, rich creamy body. It's pleasant to drink but with a treacly/strong lingering taste that might not appeal to everyone.
slightly sour, fruity, nutty? A bit wine-like, it was interesting but I wasn't sure what to make of it. Would try again.
Belgian-style strong ale with slightly fruity, toasty flavour. It was rather enjoyable.
quite fruity strong IPA but the taste was a little too strong with alcohol. Still interesting.
Easy to drink and ok but doesn't live up to the billing.
well-rounded balanced saison with mixture of fruity and hoppy flavour. Very satisfying. Must try more!
strong dark malty ale, with the honey flavour only subtle yet it provides a sweet, strong backbone which is borderline too strong - but overall it works well.
subtle but well balanced taste; nutty and a bit bitter. It's quite an enjoyable beer.
full-bodied, well-balanced triple with a sweet taste and slightly bitter backbone. Satisfying.
pleasantly hoppy and fresh, it was like summer in a bottle - delightful!
Light & fruity pale ale.. Quite subtle yet with a very interesting taste.
light brown/purplish colour, sour smell/taste, tart with vinegar, apples. Very crisp and drinkable, cider-like. Enjoyable.
well-balanced strong amber, which has a good malt presence, a pleasant, subtle fruit/bitter taste and a hint of citrus (a bit like the blonde).
Decent IPA with good malt presence.
fruity, malty and fresh, with slight bitterness, this was good stuff (similar to Bill's).
malty ale, quite nice but not as good as the Kick Off.
dark, malty beer with a rich flavour. It's good but not my preferred style.
cloudy yellow, rich silky head and a very well balance and easy to drink blonde. For me really hit the spot and was just about perfect.
malty, fruity, crisp. Decent dunkel.
saison-like, with a light hoppiness, and an assertive fruit presence provides a nice complement and balance, for an enjoyable brew.
fresh, saison-like blonde, with pleasant light hoppiness and refreshing.
strong yet alcohol well masked, and very well balanced. A bit of sweetness and hoppiness, and overall it's pretty good stuff.
nice, fresh & slightly fruity wheat beer, à la Kronenbourg Blanche.
rich and slightly sweet, this exceptionally-balanced brew really hit the spot and I'd rate it among Belgium's finest (perhaps I'm biased to this style). A real surprise coming from France.
wheat beer that is a decent example of the style and is well rounded and refreshing.

malty, slightly hoppy and with an almost citrus taste, this is interesting but a bit unbalanced, leaving a slightly bitter taste. This isn't an issue though, as it's just on the right side of interesting.
decent blonde with a herbal taste.
a refreshing wheat beer but probably less well-formed or satisfying than the Dorée.
decent kick of hops, making this interesting and overall bitter. The wheat definitely adds something, can't quite put my finger on it. Good beer.
hoppy and with a slight citrus fruit presence, similar to a pale ale, this is well balanced, bitter yet refreshing.
easy to drink with a nice flavour of cereal malt and light bitterness. Good quality brew.
dark brown colour, taste is a bit sour, crisp and tangy, backed up by the whiskey presence. It's unusual, interesting and very enjoyable. Makes me think of flawed genius.
Good pale ale but nothing special.
tart, refreshing. Didn't try much but will give it the benefit of the doubt.
smooth, creamy, fruity. A very nice brew, easily my favourite from Meantime.
not bad but a bit of harsh bitterness.
a bit of fruitiness, it was ok.
quite a strong pale ale-ish beer but overall was a bit too strong and imbalanced, despite being fairly decent and drinkable.
smooth, strong, full-bodied, bitter. A bit much at first but part way through the 750ml bottle, my taste adapted and overall it was enjoyable.
strong, rich, sweet, licquorice-flavoured, slightly spiced. Good but there are better brunes out there.
nicely hopped pale ale, cloudy and always interesting, with a pleasant bitterness. Solid effort, although some room for improvement.

strong orange colour, rich and full bodied. The alcohol is supremely well masked here and the taste is quite fruity with some bitterness, reminding me of a sweet grapefruit juice - rich in the mouth. Overall balance with combination of sugar and spices is great! Very good!

coffee bitterness typical of a porter is present in the aroma and taste, but there's not so much evidence of IPA and the taste is a bit imbalanced towards alcohol strength and bitterness for my liking. Otherwise it's not bad.
cloudy, fresh and hoppy in a very nice way, with light bitterness and fruitiness. The balance here is excellent and it tastes like the work of a master craftsman.
has an earthiness/fruitiness about it. Body is smooth, with pleasant maltiness/citrus flavour. Pretty satisfying on draught, especially after climbing Goatfell!
pleasant crisp ale with light fruitiness and bitterness, it's good but not outstanding.
smooth, rich stout with a near perfect equilibrium of coffee bitterness, sweetness and agreeable acidity. I'm sure more tasting would reveal hidden depths but on this evidence, very impressed.
nice wheat beer, with light banana presence. BB Dec 2014 but it was still nice and refreshing.
didn't have much but it was crisp and interesting.
a strength like a strong Belgian ale, and with the qualities of a strong fruity IPA, this was very enjoyable and perhaps my favourite from Skumenn.
strong amber ale, tastes like it was matured in casks of some kind. Taste is sweet and malty; the strong malty cereal flavour is promising but doesn't seem to go anywhere more interesting.
bitterness dominates the taste here - in fact I think it's a bitter. Hint of fruitiness and passable, but I'm not really a fan.

very crisp, dirty, earthy taste, slightly sour. Interestingly tangy/citrussy. That combination of citrus and earthiness works pretty well and makes for a brew that is very interesting and quite satisfying.
sweet, candy-like, alcohol well hidden, as expected. Rich and slightly malty, with a slight kick of hops. So smooth and pure tasting - be careful it creeps up on you!
slightly sweet, with toasted malt flavour. Good but I imagine better if on draught/not 1.5 years past the use by date.
dark, crisp, malty, wheaty and well balanced. Enjoyable despite being so much past the use by date.
light, crisp, citrussy, refreshing - but not very exciting. Would be a great hot weather beer.
Smooth, creamy & malty, well defined flavour. Slightly bitter.
Unexciting, basic lager but has a pleasant lingering malty finish and is a good thirst quencher.
tastes triple-like, but weaker, slightly bitter and citrussy. Crisp, refreshing and tangy. Smooth yeastiness in the background? Overall quite satisfying.
very smooth, thin in consistency, but has a brilliantly balanced flavour of milky coffee and a hint of chocolate. Quality stuff.
dark, smooth, rich, warming alcohol. Sweet flavour of marzipan/banana, spices. Quite alcoholic but still pleasantly so. Great beer.
crisp, citrussy and refreshing, this pale beer hits the spot. Not particularly complex but the pleasant citrus taste is a success.
rich, Belgian-style amber ale, fruity, slightly spicy (was that the wasabi?) and strong. All in all, a quality beer.

lemony scent and very pale colour. Palate is crisp sweetness and refreshing, with hints of citrus. Tastes more like a strong, citrussy lager than a wheat beer to me. Overall I'm very impressed by how good this was.

red colour, rich head, fruity scent. Slightly fruity taste, bitterness in the aftertaste, strong but not overwhelming alcohol taste. Reminds me of The Cone. I think the strength is a little too much and this is almost a very good beer.

foamy head which disappears quickly, and cloudy amber appearance like a wheat beer. Crisp, fizzy mouthfeel. Quite strong alcohol taste, yet quite flat in flavour. Overall though it's a nice flavour; a bit of citrus, a bit of caramel.
very cloudy, drinkable beer with strong banana smell/taste. Very I enjoyable.
not a typical wheat beer, with hoppy bitterness/malts. It's interesting, well-balanced and a pleasure to drink.
good well balanced IPA. The balance was key here.
enjoyable dark lager, went down a treat.
straightforward lager as accompaniment to food. Good fizz/malt character. Fine by me.
a decent tripel, don't remember the specifics.

light head, light body, interesting & unusual. Smells alcoholic. Slightly bitter, slightly strong alcohol taste. Overall enjoyable, with a grainy aroma/taste, but perhaps too strong and singularly bitter.
strong and amber-coloured, this is quite bitter but really well balanced and full of character. Very satisfying.
amber colour, with hoppy bitter taste and slight malt flavour. While not exciting the balance is good and the end result is satisfying.
quite prominent banana small/taste, but a bit watery as a whole. That said, still an enjoyable beer.
on draft, was well rounded with good character. Decent lager taste which was well balanced. Found it very enjoyable.
light, crisp with hint of coffee, a bit less boring than its light sibling. Despite the lack of excitement it's pleasant and refreshing. It reminds me of Coke but with the sugar removed.
pale ale-ish with malts in the flavour. Not exactly sure what this is but it's ok by me.
rich amber beer with nice malt character. Enjoyable! This is probably the 13.
Crisp, malty, smooth amber ale. Faint bitterness but nice malt/sweet character and very enjoyable indeed!
amber beer with decent foamy head. Difficult to know what it is, but is crisp and lager-like with a nice malty character. Very drinkable.
cloudy yellow, hoppy and citrussy pale ale that is well-balanced. Enjoyable stuff.

tastes like other Fantomes I've had, it's citrussy and spicy with a strong amber colour and the alcohol is very well disguised. Can't really taste the dandelion but it's got a flavour full of character and doesn't disappoint!
less of a malt presence than other kolsch, but with a slight fruitiness. One of my less favourite but still ok.

it had a healthy head and is cloudy with plenty sediment. As well as appearance, the flavour is similar to that of a wheat beer, with hints of banana etc. However, this has more of a cereal, barley-like taste than a wheat beer. At times, there's the sense of fizzy water in the mouth but generally, enjoyable enough.

unwittingly cracked this open on a Monday evening, not realising the % - it's very strong! Definite smell of coffee and vanilla. To taste it's a bit strong but gradually it becomes more drinkable. Rich coffee flavour with some vanilla and hint of chocolate. It's got a thick and creamy texture and hence lives up to its name.

tastes more like a pale ale to me than a kolsch. Subtle hops and fruitiness combine to make a refreshing but confused-tasting beer. I feel the maltiness that should be in a kolsch is mainly washed away by the fruit flavour.
subtle flavour but very crisp and satisfying.
very unusual, cloudy with fruity smell and earthy, slightly bitter, malty taste. I enjoyed it, certainly interesting and unique.
strong well-balanced lager, with hint of sweetness. Satisfying.
Whistle Binkies, draft. Decent lager, but don't remember much more.
coffee aroma with coffee taste and a slight creaminess, although a bit thin. Overall quite nice.
decent 80 shilling-style ale. Good malt character and enjoyable to drink.
dark with rich creamy head, coffee/smoky/dark malty taste. Threatens to be something special.
tart raspberry flavour combined with whisky flavours. Rich and strong in alcohol yet the balance on this is great. Can't fault it, I want more!
good, but not great, amber hoppy ale (bitter?). Perfectly ok.
crisp, light & refreshing lager with a bit of citrus. Enjoyable.
fruity/bitter/hoppy combo in a nicely balanced ale. Well made but not exciting.
decent, slight fruity lager. Very drinkable. Rather nice.
decent strong brown ale, but had a sweetish, slightly industrial taste which let it down slightly.
strong, mature-tasting lager-like beer. Sweetish malty taste; quite nice and drinkable.
didn't taste of much but was very crisp, refreshing and fresh.
well rounded/balanced and of course hoppy. Very good.
the overall impression was bitterness which lingered in the mouth. Not keen to have it again, as, although it's not necessarily a bad beer per se, it was just a bit much for my taste.
rich, smooth stout with roasted flavour. Very well balanced, I'm very impressed - goes down an absolute treat.
good use of hops; quite a rich flavour. Has quite a strong bitter kick that my mouth adjusted to after a few glugs of the bottle. Overall seemed well rounded and full of character.
well balanced dubbel-like ale. Smooth with a rich satisfying taste.
amber coloured with a rich initial head. Fantastic balance with a nutty/fruity flavour and richness to it. Great stuff.
stout-ish beer with a light taste and pleasant roasted malt flavour. Nice.
a very well-rounded wheat beer with the typical flavours but a cut above most.
annoyingly couldn't fully taste but it was cloudy and definitely had an obvious presence of rhubarb. Try it again!
couldn't fully taste but it was clear this is a quality saison. Must try again!
despite man flu, got a good taste of this from 2 different tastings and was very impressed. Very moreish.
rich strong IPA. Very good quality.
strong stuff; will need to try again to get the full flavour.
initial taste quite nice and fruity but overall it's unbalanced with too much weight on the bitterness.
light pale ale with fruity, cereal-like flavour. Very palatable and balanced.
fresh, herbal, citrussy flavours. Quite bitter aftertaste but I found it very enjoyable.
Didn't taste like a standard wheat beer but pretty enjoyable stuff. Was it even wheat beer?
quite thick lager with cereal flavour that dominates. Sweet.
slightly sour and full bodied, with obvious fruit presence. Must retry.
sour and sweet with very obvious vanilla presence. The balance is very good. Overall refreshing and leaves a nice aftertaste, similar to nutty chocolate!
smooth, strong Belgian-style ale. A bit sweet and fruity. Overall caught me off guard and is pretty impressive stuff.
quite a fruity kolsch, not so malty like others. Quite enjoyable.
great well rounded, well balanced refreshing IPA. Could easily drink several in one sitting.
amber coloured, quadrupel-like, spiced, hoppy flavour. Alcohol very well hidden and the taste overall is complex and rich. Yet another example of great Belgian brewing.
surprisingly good; slightly hoppy and creamy, and seemed like it was made for draught. Despite nothing exciting going on, thoroughly enjoyed it.
nice wheat beer with slightly sweet, toasty flavour. Thoroughly enjoyable.
great well rounded, well balanced refreshing IPA. Could easily drink several in one sitting.
Dominated by a sweetish lactose taste. Cocoa flavour is there. Frankly ok.
Fruity, wheaty, full-bodied. Healthiest head of the lot. Bit of a bitter aftertaste but fine.
IPA, a bit fruity but with a bitter kick. I think it's alright but a bit unbalanced.
Belgian dubbel. Rich, fruity taste. Straightforward flavour that you'd expect from this style, with not much complexity but quite good.
In the glass, looked impeccable, like a wax sculpture. To taste: a good porter, smooth and very well balanced. Nice flavour too.
Reddish in colour, with a creamy head. Overall a nice beer.
Tasted a bit like lime, but probably because there was a slice of lime in it! That aside, a generic-tasting but refreshing lager.
Described by the barman as "like a Mexian 80 shilling", this turned out to be almost that, a dark "special" beer that is a cut above the standard foreign imports.
Fairly generic pilsner. Quite drinkable, but nothing out of the ordinary going on. Accompanies a kebab pretty well though! But, seriously: "No. 1 Mediterranean beer"?!
An unashamed blast of hops dominates this. It's a bit one dimensional but unpretentious and despite the bitterness is enjoyable.
Mytholm Mist: cloudy, very carbonated wheat beer. The balance isn't perfect and the flavour is a balance of citrus and slightly bitter hops. Overall, it's an enjoyable brew.
amber coloured, quadrupel-like, spiced, hoppy flavour. Alcohol very well hidden and the taste overall is complex and rich. Yet another example of great Belgian brewing.
has a pleasant malty/lagery taste. Won't win any world beer awards any time soon but I'd definitely drink it again.

impulse buy from a Polish shop, features Penelope Cruz on the label. Turns out this is a low ABV beer at 0.5% but doesn't bear much resemblance to actual beer. Smells a bit like wet dog mixed with brown sugar. Tastes like cold sugary coffee. While it's not terrible, I found it way too sweet and even Ms Cruz couldn't prevent it from being poured straight down the sink!

light, crisp dark beer with hint of coffee in the flavour and a bit less boring than its light sibling. Despite the lack of excitement it's pleasant and refreshing. It reminds me of Coke but with the sugar removed.

citrus IPA, tasted in Brew Dog, Edinburgh. Smells like grapefruit, and essentially tastes like an IPA mixed with grapefruit juice - but it's well balanced and the overall bitterness is well under control.
With a big head, this is a smooth and rich beer with the typical flavours of banana, cloves etc that you'd normally find in this style. Perhaps a bit of spice as well. All in all, a great wheat beer.
